title: How has the proportion of people who drank heavily in the past week changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of people who reported to have drunk heavily (over 8 units for men or over 6 units for women on their heaviest drinking day) in the last week has decreased in the 16-44 age groups over the period 2005 to 2012 but has remained stable in the older age groups. The 16-24 age group saw a 10% reduction over this time for men and women. The government published Safe. Sensible. Social. in 2007 which set out the next steps in the National Alcohol Strategy since the publication of the Alcohol Harm Reduction Strategy for England in 2004. In 2012 the government published the Alcohol Strategy which shows the governments focus on reducing alcohol related harm over recent years.
data_source: Office for National Statistics, Opinions and Lifestyle Survey, Drinking Habits Amongst Adults, 2012
